section.title: Chief Complaint and Reason for Visit

list.item:
Primary Diagnosis
Hypertensive disorder, systemic arterial (disorder)

Encounter Diagnosis
Hypertensive disorder, systemic arterial (disorder)

Clinical Note
82 ys old Caucasian male obese former smoker with a long history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, Type II diabetes with mild renal insufficiency and peripheral neuropathy. Mild CHF for the past 10 years. The hypertension was previously controlled with Lisinopril 10 mg daily. At the last visit, 3 weeks ago, the BP was 158/89. The dose of lisinopril was increased from 10 mg to 20 mg/day.
